pages.text: This entry contains information as well as advice on the many methods of connectivity to Create's appliances and more. $(br2)As a general rule of thumb when it comes to using cogwheels you take into account what direction they are rotating to avoid future building headaches.

As always, please refer to the Ponder viewer by hovering your cursor on the items on the page for a more thorough explanation and more complete index. $(br2)The tooltip should appear and have the $(3)Hold [W] to Ponder$() prompt.

The most basic way of relaying kinetic rotation and serves as the main connection point for many of Create's blocks. $(br2)It does so in a straight line and can be rotated horizontally in two directions and one direction vertically.

A helpful placement tip is that while you are looking at the hitbox of the Shaft block, a preview and arrow will appear to show you where the next shaft will be placed. You never have to look at the end of the blockface again!
